originalText.text:
üö´ AVOID Thrifty Car Rentals at all costs! THEY ARE JUST SCAMMER üö´
THE MOST AWFUL EXPERIENCE EVER .I ended up with a bill that was $639 higher than what I expected when I initially made the reservation, a massive threefold increase. At Orlando airport desk, the agent failed to disclose or explain the additional services they included without my knowledge. Seeking a refund only led to a frustrating runaround between Thrifty's customer service and Spirit Airways, where I had initially placed the reservation. It's evident that by focusing on short-term gains, Thrifty is risking the loyalty of customers. It's crucial for companies to respect their customers' understanding and be clear when offering optional services. Moreover, the two-hour wait in line to get the car only compounded the frustration of the entire experience. I highly recommend considering other reputable car rental companies to avoid similar issues. ‚ö†Ô∏è KEEP AWAY FROM Thrifty Car Rental for a smoother and more transparent rental process elsewhere. ‚ö†Ô∏è

originalText.text: I was skeptical of this place because of the Reviews on here. My Credit card company suggested them or else i‚Äôd have to take an Uber to the Airport to get a car. It was a great experience renting from them. I‚Äôve rented twice now. Both times my reservation was handled by a Bald dude with glasses named Kenny. That dude is efficient and quick. Whether picking up or Returning the car I‚Äôve had no hassles thus far and will likely rent from them Primarily because it‚Äôs easier to get to them via the Train as a person who lives ‚ÄúUptown.‚Äù They have good vehicles also.

originalText.text: Great price and Kenny & Kaelin were super calm in spite of the chaos that is a Saturday in Manhattan! Remember,THIS IS MANHATTAN, NYC! Just because you've reserved a car, doesn't mean the car has been returned on time. Be patient, and plan ahead - give yourself extra time. Thanks Thrifty.

originalText.text: These people literally stole my money along with Expedia. Avoid at all costs, oh and even better, they have NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. So, you can't speak to anyone or get the matter resolved with anyone over the phone or even in person. This company is a scam! Save yourself time and money and just go to Hertz or something. It's a bit extra but you can have more peace of mind with them. I booked a car through Expedia to go on a trip and on Expedia I was told the deposit was $50, when I arrived to Thrifty to pick up my car, they said the deposit is actually $250!!! So I told them to cancel the reservation and give me my money back - seems fair right, I never drove off the lot - well, nope. They decided to keep my down payment which is like $127 and not refund me at all. SCAMMERS!!!

originalText.text: Reserved a car weeks in advance but somehow they didn‚Äôt have a car when I arrived and they weren‚Äôt able to pull a car from another location. I feel like they should have a legal obligation to call you in advance if they don‚Äôt have a car. I ended up having to pay $400 to use a Zipcar for my trip instead.
